meanings.definition: A person who changes sides or opinions frequently.
meanings.sent1: The tergiversators in the debate kept switching their stance.
meanings.sent2: Politicians are often seen as tergiversators when they flip-flop on issues.
meanings.sent3: The tergiversators at the meeting couldn't make up their minds, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her friends jokingly called her a tergiversator because she couldn't stick to one decision.
meanings.sent5: The image of a tergiversator constantly spinning in circles represents indecisiveness.

meanings.definition: To change sides or opinions frequently.
meanings.sent1: He tends to tergiversate when faced with tough choices.
meanings.sent2: The weather can quickly tergiversate from sunny to stormy in this region.
meanings.sent3: Don't tergiversate between the two options; make a firm decision.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions tergiversated wildly throughout the day, leaving her exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The plot of the movie tergiversated so much that it was hard to follow.
